meanings.definition: A supernatural creature in Islamic mythology, typically capable of granting wishes.
meanings.sent1: The djinni appeared in a puff of smoke, ready to grant the young girl's wish.
meanings.sent2: Legend has it that if you rub a magic lamp, a djinni will emerge to grant you three wishes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous djinni granted the wish for a million dollars, but in pennies!
meanings.sent4: The djinni's power to grant wishes was as potent as a magic spell.
meanings.sent5: The children listened wide-eyed as the storyteller described the djinni's ability to make dreams come true.

meanings.definition: A genie or spirit in Middle Eastern folklore.
meanings.sent1: The djinni in the old tale offered three wishes to the weary traveler.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the djinni emerged from the lamp with a swirl of smoke.
meanings.sent3: The djinni's mischievous grin hinted at the tricks it could play on unsuspecting mortals.
meanings.sent4: The djinni's power was as mysterious and ancient as the desert sands.
meanings.sent5: The old man warned of the djinni's ability to twist words and intentions to his advantage.
